text: The FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup is an international association football tournament for female players under the age of 17. It is organized by Fédération Internationale de Football Association (FIFA). ==Results== Edition Year Host Final Final Final Third place match Third place match Third place match Number of Teams Edition Year Host Champions Score Runners-up Third place Score Fourth place Number of Teams 1 2008 Details 2–1 3–0 16 2 2010 Details 3–3 1–0 16 3 2012 Details 1–1 1–0 16 4 2014 Details 2–0 4–4 16 5 2016 Details 0–0 4–0 16 6 2018 Details 2–1 2–1 16 — 2020 Cancelled due to COVID-19 pandemic Cancelled due to COVID-19 pandemic Cancelled due to COVID-19 pandemic 16 7 2022 Details 16 ===Teams reaching the top four=== Team Titles Runners-up Third place Fourth place 2 (2008, 2016) 1 (2012) – 1 (2010) 1 (2014) 2 (2010, 2016) – – 1 (2018) 1 (2014) 2 (2010, 2016) – 1 (2010) – – – 1 (2012) – – – – 1 (2008) – – – 1 (2018) – – – – 1 (2008) 1 (2012) – – 1 (2012) – – – 1 (2014) – – – 1 (2018) – – – – 2 (2014, 2016) – – – 1 (2008) – – – 1 (2018) ==Awards== Tournament Golden Ball Golden Shoe Award Goals Golden Glove Fair Play Award 2008 New Zealand Mana Iwabuchi Dzsenifer Marozsán 6 Taylor Vancil 2010 Trinidad and Tobago Yeo Min-ji Yeo Min-ji 8 Dolores Gallardo 2012 Azerbaijan Griedge Mbock Bathy Ri Un-sim 8 Romane Bruneau 2014 Costa Rica Hina Sugita Deyna Castellanos Gabriela García 6 Mamiko Matsumoto 2016 Jordan Fuka Nagano Lorena Navarro 8 Noelia Ramos 2018 Uruguay Clàudia Pina Mukarama Abdulai 7 Catalina Coll 2022 India ==References==
